channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: The Obamas Electrify in Chicago, and a Secret U.S. Nuclear Defense Plan
item.description: Plus, eating meat may raise diabetes risk, studies suggest.

item.title: Middle East Crisis: Israel and Hezbollah Exchange Strikes Amid Fears of Escalation
item.description: The Israeli military said it had hit weapons facilities, prompting Hezbollah to target an Israeli base, as tit-for-tat strikes continued across the Lebanese border.

item.title: Famed economist Ed Yardeni predicts it’ll be ‘one and done’ for Fed rate cuts despite Wall Street expectations
item.description: Yardeni is unconvinced the data is cool enough to push Chair Powell and his colleagues to multiple cuts: "It'll be dovish but not as dovish as the market is discounting."

item.title: Russia Seeks to Turn Humbling Incursion Into Military Gains
item.description: Two weeks after Ukraine launched its surprise attack, Russian forces have recovered from the initial shock and are trying to use the expanding war to their battlefield advantage.

item.title: Video Shows the Aftermath of a Bus Crash in Iran that Killed Dozens
item.description: The wreckage of the vehicle that overturned in Iran, killing at least 28 pilgrims from Pakistan, in footage broadcast on an Iranian TV channel.

item.title: France to donate 100,000 mpox vaccines as nation prepares for outbreak at home
item.description: Last week the health agency of the African Union said 200,000 vaccines would be deployed across Africa, due to agreements with the EU and Danish drug company Bavarian Nordic.

item.title: Who’s the Change Candidate?
item.description: Inside the fight over who most represents change ahead of November.

item.title: Waterspout Was Seen When the Bayesian Yacht Sank in Sicily. What Is It?
item.description: Witnesses reported seeing the tornado-like phenomenon hit the Bayesian, a sailing yacht that sank off the coast of Sicily on Monday.

item.title: Las Vegas Venetian workers win historic contract with major pay boosts
item.description: Described by the Culinary Union as their “best contracts ever,” the deals ended lengthy labor disputes that had brought the threat of a historic strike to the Las Vegas Strip.

item.title: At the Drum Corps World Championship, Perfection Is the Expectation
item.description: Every summer, hundreds of college-age musicians spend countless hours — and their own money — pursuing a single goal: the drum corps world championship.

item.title: Russia Seeks to Turn Humbling Incursion Into Military Gains
item.description: Two weeks after Ukraine launched its surprise attack, Russian forces have recovered from the initial shock and are trying to use the expanding war to their battlefield advantage.

item.title: Atlassian’s billionaire cofounder wants to send renewable power from Australia to Singapore via a 2,600 mile-long undersea cable
item.description: On Wednesday, Australia approved an ambitious project from Mike Cannon-Brookes's SunCable to connect Singapore with a massive Australian solar farm.

item.title: ‘I Am the Only Person Stupid Enough to Speak After Michelle Obama’
item.description: So said former President Barack Obama after his wife electrified the Democratic National Convention. The delegates loved him, but they really loved her.

item.title: Maria Branyas Morera, World’s Oldest Person, Dies at 117
item.description: Ms. Branyas, who cultivated a following on social media as “Super Catalan Grandma,” died peacefully in her sleep, her family said.

item.title: Tesla is the EU’s top choice getting lower tariffs compared to rivals on its China-made cars
item.description: The European Union said Tuesday it plans to introduce an additional 9% tariff on Teslas imported from China.
